meanings.definition: A book containing examples of handwriting or calligraphy for imitation.
meanings.sent1: In school, we practiced our handwriting by copying from the copybook.
meanings.sent2: She carefully studied the elegant calligraphy in the copybook.
meanings.sent3: The copybook was so fancy, it made my handwriting look like a masterpiece!
meanings.sent4: Her handwriting was like a work of art, straight out of a copybook.
meanings.sent5: The copybook displayed beautiful handwriting that inspired me to improve.

meanings.definition: A book in which copies are written or printed for practice.
meanings.sent1: He diligently filled out the copybook with neat rows of numbers.
meanings.sent2: The students used the copybook to practice writing their names.
meanings.sent3: The copybook was filled with so many copies, it looked like a clone factory!
meanings.sent4: Her copybook was a mirror image of perfection, reflecting her hard work.
meanings.sent5: The copybook was a valuable tool for honing their writing skills.
